bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CONYERS:H.R. 2667.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, section 8, clause 4 of the Constitution.[Page H5661]

item.name: Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet Subcommittee
Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Commercial and Administrative Law.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text: Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Administration Improvement Act of 2011 - Amends federal bankruptcy law to: (1) increase the limits governing trustee compensation in a case under chapter 7; and (2) authorize the court, in determining the amount of reasonable compensation to be awarded to a trustee under chapter 7, to treat such compensation as a commission.

bill.title: Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Administration Improvement Act of 2011

item.title: Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Administration Improvement Act of 2011
To provide for improvements to the administration of bankruptcy in cases under chapter 7 of title 11 of the United States Code.
Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Administration Improvement Act of 2011

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Commercial and Administrative Law.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
